Linus sets off a full-blown cheese debate after trashing American cheese again. Is it real cheese? Does it belong on burgers? What about grilled cheese sandwiches? Linus, Luke, Dan, and chat dive into emulsifiers, melting behaviour, cooking techniques, and whether Craft Singles deserve a spot at the table (spoiler: Linus says no).

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVYbTzyuxu4

title: The Cheese Incident

The European Commission is cracking down. Apple gets fined €500 million and Meta another €200 million for their anti-competitive practices. But somehow, Facebook Marketplace dodges regulation? Meanwhile, starting June 20th, all smartphones and tablets sold in the EU will need labels for battery life, energy efficiency, and repairability. The guys dive into the EU’s new tech rules, how repairability is measured, and what this could mean for consumers and manufacturers alike.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVYbTzyuxu4

With Discord’s CEO stepping down and the company preparing for a potential IPO, the question looms: could anything actually replace Discord? The team explores viable alternatives like TeamSpeak, Mumble, and even Steam, and dives into what it would take to make users abandon the platform for good.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVYbTzyuxu4

Bethesda surprise-launches the Oblivion remaster with barely any marketing, and it's already a hit. Luke dives into why it’s resonating with fans, what makes it different (two engines?!), and whether you should hold out for Skyblivion instead. Plus, they talk about misleading store listings, mod support, and yes… the return of horse armour.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVYbTzyuxu4
